snippet: Mrs. Obama’s adjustment to the White House — including, at times, severe tension with her husband’s staff — illuminates some of President Obama’s central challenges.
abstract: New book The Obamas by New York Times reporter Jodi Kantor suggests that First Lady Michelle Obama's popular public persona belies a sometimes difficult transition to life in the White House, where she has clashed with some members of her husbands staff over their handling of several issues; interviews with dozens of current and former aides show that she has been an unrecognized force in her husband's administration and that her story has been one first of struggle, then turnaround and greater fulfillment.
lead_paragraph: Mrs. Obama’s adjustment to the White House — including, at times, severe tension with her husband’s staff — illuminates some of President Obama’s central challenges.

headline.seo: Michelle Obama’s Evolution as First Lady
headline.main: Michelle Obama and the Evolution of a First Lady
headline.print_headline: First Lady’s Fraught White House Journey to Greater Fulfillment
